contentrichtext.text: '''DOA''' is often an acronym for [[dead on arrival]] or [[Dead or Alive (disambiguation)|Dead or Alive]]. '''DOA''' may also refer to: {{TOCright}} == Film == *[[D.O.A. (1950 film)|''D.O.A.'' (1950 film)]], a ''film noir'' *[[D.O.A. (1988 film)|''D.O.A.'' (1988 film)]], a remake of the 1950 film *''[[D.O.A.: A Rite of Passage]]'' (1980 film), a documentary on the genesis of punk rock *''[[DOA: Dead or Alive]]'' (2006 film) == Music == *[[D.O.A. (band)]], a Vancouver punk band *[[DOA (album)|''DOA'' (album)]], an album by Bloodrock *"[[Children's Heritage/D.O.A.]]", a 1970 song by Bloodrock *"D.O.A." (Dead or Alive), a song on the 1979 Van Halen album ''[[Van Halen II]]'' *"D.O.A.", a song from Loverboy's 1980 album [[Loverboy (Loverboy album)|''Loverboy'' (album)]] *"D.O.A", is a song by [[The Haunted]] in their album ''[[One Kill Wonder]]'' *"D.O.A.", from the 1990 [[Dead Moon]] album ''13 Off My Hook'' * [[Dogs On Acid]], a Drum & Bass website and messageboard *"[[DOA (song)|"DOA" (song)]]", from the 2005 Foo Fighters album ''In Your Honor'' *"D.O.A.", a song by Coroner from their album ''[[No More Color]]'' *"[[D.O.A. (Death of Auto-Tune)]]", a song by Jay-Z *[[doa (Japanese band)]], a rock band from Japan *''[[D.o.A: The Third and Final Report]]'', a Throbbing Gristle album *[[Dead on Arrival (song)|"Dead on Arrival" (song)]], a song from the 2003 Fall Out Boy album ''Take This To Your Grave'' *"D.O.A.", a song on the 2010 [[Brotha Lynch Hung]] album [[Dinner and a Movie (album)]] *"D.O.A" is the name of a song from the album ''[[Mimic47]]'' by [[Diablo (band)|Diablo]] *A live/compilation album by the band [[Charged GBH]] was titled ''Dead on Arrival: A Punk Rock Anthology'' (2005). *'Dead on arrival' is a song by [[Evol Intent]]. == Television == *"''D.O.A''" a 2010 [[BBC Three]] television comedy starring [[Kris Marshall]] and [[Karen Taylor (comedian)|Karen Taylor]] *[[D.O.A. (Tru Calling)|"D.O.A." (Tru Calling)]], an episode of American drama series ''Tru Calling'' *"[[DOA For a Day]]", a 4th season episode of CSI: NY *"D.O.A." was the penultimate episode of Season Six in NBC's hit crime drama ''[[List of Crossing Jordan episodes|Crossing Jordan]]''. == Chemicals == *[[Dioctyl adipate]], or DOA, an ester of n-octanol and adipic acid, to form a plasticizer oil *The illegal substance [[phencyclidine]] (PCP) is occasionally slangly termed "dead-on-arrival" ==Video games== *In the video game [[Max Payne 2]], DoA is a playable mode unlocked after the first playthrough. *In the video game [[Dead Space (video game)|Dead Space]], the title of Chapter 9 is "Dead on Arrival." *In the video game [[SWAT 3]], dead civilians, hostages, and suspects are referred to as "DOA". *In the video game [[SWAT 4]], in the mission "St. Michael's Medical Center" there are few civilians down on the floor and SWAT team leader refers to them as DOA. == Other == *[[Department of Alaska]] *[[Disciples of Apocalypse]], a biker-themed professional wrestling stable *[[Department of Agriculture]] *[[Department of the Army]] *[[Substance abuse|Drugs of abuse]], a DOA panel test is a test performed for the qualitative determination of drug substances in humans *[[Double Action]] Only, a type of firing mechanism found in firearms. *[[Date of Arrival]] *[[Dragons of Atlantis]]; a game popular in [[Google+]], [[Facebook]] and many other sites. *In [[Total Nonstop Action Wrestling]], the wrestler Suicide names his finishing maneuver, a [[Powerbomb]] variant, the DOA. ==See also== * [[Doa (moth)]] * {{Intitle|DOA}} {{disambig}}
